greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the number of quadratic residues of A085635(n).
comment: Note that the terms are not all distinct.
link: Keith F. Lynch, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200 (first 111 terms from Hugo Pfoertner).
Andreas Enge, William Hart, Fredrik Johansson, Short addition sequences for theta functions, arXiv:1608.06810 [math.NT], 2016-2018.
example: a(2)=2 because there are 2 different quadratic residues modulo 3, so 3 has 66.67% of quadratic residues density, while 2 has a 100%, so 3 has the least quadratic residues density up to 3.
mathematica: Block[{s = Range[0, 2^15 + 1]^2, t}, t = Array[{#1/#2, #2} & @@ {#, Length@ Union@ Mod[Take[s, # + 1], #]} &, Length@ s - 1]; Map[t[[All, -1]][[FirstPosition[t[[All, 1]], #][[1]] ]] &, Union@ FoldList[Max, t[[All, 1]] ] ] ] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 10 2018 *)
results.author: Jose R. Brox (tautocrona(AT)terra.es), Jul 12 2003
